summary: This is an FBI 302 report documenting an interview with a former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence. The witness describes her employment, the high turnover of staff, Epstein's interactions with young 'massage girls,' and a specific incident where an underage-looking female came to the residence demanding money. The witness also provides phone numbers and documents related to her employment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The wealthy financier whose Palm Beach residence the witness managed. Described as initially nice but becoming 'mean,' and as someone who gave money to girls for college or modeling.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Believed by the witness to be Epstein's girlfriend; she hired the witness for the house manager position. Women would visit the residence even when she was not there.

persons.name: Nicole Ness
persons.context: The FBI agent who conducted the interview with the witness, as noted in the document header.

connections.description: Witness believed Maxwell was Epstein's girlfriend and that Maxwell hired staff for his residence.
Maxwell was involved in hiring staff, like the witness, for Epstein's residence.

events.title: FBI Interview of Former House Manager
events.description: The witness, a former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence, is interviewed by FBI agents regarding the federal investigation into the sexual exploitation of minors.

events.title: Incident with Underage Female at Residence
events.description: An unidentified female who looked under 18 arrived at Epstein's Palm Beach residence in a taxi demanding money. The witness was instructed by Epstein's New York office to pay her $200 from Epstein's desk.

events.title: Christmas Gift Distribution to 'Massage Girls'
events.description: The witness was asked to call 5 or 6 of Epstein's 'massage girls' to inform them they could pick up their Christmas gifts.

locations: Epstein's residence on the island of Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: A former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence was interviewed by the FBI as part of a federal investigation into the sexual exploitation of minors.
The witness described a high turnover of staff at the residence because Epstein, Maxwell, and others 'were not very nice to the hired help.'
The witness frequently took messages from girls who wanted to 'work for Epstein' and was once tasked with calling his 'massage girls' about Christmas gifts.
A specific incident was described where an underage-looking female came to the residence demanding money; the witness was instructed by Epstein's New York office to pay her $200 from Epstein's desk.

The witness believed Epstein was trying to help girls 'make it big in the modeling industry' by giving them money for college or to start modeling, indicating she may have been unaware of the exploitative nature of his actions.
